metadata.Title: CVE-2014-125023 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A vulnerability was found in FFmpeg 2.0. It has been declared as problematic. Affected by this vulnerability is the function truemotion1_decode_header of the component Truemotion1 Handler. The manipulation leads to memory corruption. The attack can be launched remotely. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-125023` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra58 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavcodec58 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavdevice58 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra7 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavfilter7 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavformat58 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavresample4 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libavutil56 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libpostproc55 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libswresample3 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
libswscale5 - 7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.2.2-1ubuntu1').
